page_title: "hw_order Data Source - hw"
subcategory: ""
description: |-
  A comprehensive data source that returns a complete order example with nested object structures. Demonstrates complex data source outputs with nested attributes, perfect for learning how to work with structured data in Terraform.
  Example Usage:
  
  # Get example order data
  data "hw_order" "example" {}
  
  # Access nested sandwich attributes
  output "sandwich_info" {
    value = {
      bread = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.bread
      meat  = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.meat
      name  = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.name
    }
  }
  
  # Access nested drink attributes
  output "drink_info" {
    value = {
      kind = data.hw_order.example.drink.kind
      ice  = data.hw_order.example.drink.ice
    }
  }
  
  # Use order data to create resources
  resource "hw_bread" "from_order" {
    kind = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.bread
  }
  
  resource "hw_meat" "from_order" {
    kind = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.meat
  }
  
  resource "hw_sandwich" "from_order" {
    bread_id = hw_bread.from_order.id
    meat_id  = hw_meat.from_order.id
    description = "Sandwich from order data: ${data.hw_order.example.sandwich.name}"
  }
  
  # Access nested list (ice configuration)
  output "ice_config" {
    value = [
      for ice in data.hw_order.example.drink.ice : {
        some = ice.some
        lots = ice.lots
        max  = ice.max
      }
    ]
  }
  
  # Check ice preferences
  locals {
    has_ice = length(data.hw_order.example.drink.ice) > 0
    max_ice = try(data.hw_order.example.drink.ice[0].max, false)
  }
  
  Key Concepts:
  Demonstrates nested object attributes (sandwich, drink)Shows nested list attributes (ice configuration)Access nested data with dot notation: data.hw_order.example.sandwich.breadPerfect for learning complex data structures

# hw_order (Data Source)

A comprehensive data source that returns a complete order example with nested object structures. Demonstrates complex data source outputs with nested attributes, perfect for learning how to work with structured data in Terraform.

**Example Usage:**

```hcl
# Get example order data
data "hw_order" "example" {}

# Access nested sandwich attributes
output "sandwich_info" {
  value = {
    bread = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.bread
    meat  = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.meat
    name  = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.name
  }
}

# Access nested drink attributes
output "drink_info" {
  value = {
    kind = data.hw_order.example.drink.kind
    ice  = data.hw_order.example.drink.ice
  }
}

# Use order data to create resources
resource "hw_bread" "from_order" {
  kind = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.bread
}

resource "hw_meat" "from_order" {
  kind = data.hw_order.example.sandwich.meat
}

resource "hw_sandwich" "from_order" {
  bread_id = hw_bread.from_order.id
  meat_id  = hw_meat.from_order.id
  description = "Sandwich from order data: ${data.hw_order.example.sandwich.name}"
}

# Access nested list (ice configuration)
output "ice_config" {
  value = [
    for ice in data.hw_order.example.drink.ice : {
      some = ice.some
      lots = ice.lots
      max  = ice.max
    }
  ]
}

# Check ice preferences
locals {
  has_ice = length(data.hw_order.example.drink.ice) > 0
  max_ice = try(data.hw_order.example.drink.ice[0].max, false)
}
```

**Key Concepts:**
- Demonstrates **nested object attributes** (sandwich, drink)
- Shows **nested list attributes** (ice configuration)
- Access nested data with dot notation: `data.hw_order.example.sandwich.bread`
- Perfect for learning complex data structures

*Order complete now,*
*Sandwich and drink together,*
*Meal is ready soon.*



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Read-Only

- `drink` (Attributes) Drink specifications (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--drink))
- `id` (String) Data source identifier
- `sandwich` (Attributes) Sandwich specifications (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--sandwich))

<a id="nestedatt--drink"></a>
### Nested Schema for `drink`

Read-Only:

- `ice` (Attributes List) Ice configuration (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--drink--ice))
- `kind` (String) The drink kind

<a id="nestedatt--drink--ice"></a>
### Nested Schema for `drink.ice`

Read-Only:

- `lots` (Boolean) Lots of ice
- `max` (Boolean) Maximum ice
- `some` (Boolean) Some ice



<a id="nestedatt--sandwich"></a>
### Nested Schema for `sandwich`

Read-Only:

- `bread` (String) The bread type
- `meat` (String) The meat type
- `name` (String) The sandwich name
